value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Understanding context transition

value.title: Introduction to creating measures using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Data Analysis Expressionsâ€¯(DAX) is a programming language that is used throughout Microsoft Power BI for creating calculated columns, measures, and custom tables. It is a collection of functions, operators, and constants that can be used in a formula, or expression, to calculate and return one or more values. You can use DAX to solve a number of calculations and data analysis problems, which can help you create new information from data that is already in your model.

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. These calculations can be more helpful

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
